meanings.definition: Stinginess or unwillingness to spend money
meanings.sent1: Her niggardliness with her allowance made it hard for her to enjoy simple pleasures.
meanings.sent2: His niggardliness was evident when he refused to contribute even a small amount to the charity.
meanings.sent3: The niggardliness of the character in the story led to comical situations where they tried to save every penny.
meanings.sent4: The niggardliness of the landlord in fixing the leaky roof caused more damage in the long run.
meanings.sent5: The niggardliness of the old man was so extreme that he would reuse tea bags multiple times to save money.

meanings.definition: A quality of being excessively frugal or miserly
meanings.sent1: The niggardliness of the shopkeeper was evident in the tiny portions he served.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her niggardliness, always opting for the cheapest options available.
meanings.sent3: The niggardliness of the character in the play added a humorous touch to the otherwise serious storyline.
meanings.sent4: His niggardliness was like a heavy cloak that he wore, shielding him from generosity and warmth.
meanings.sent5: The niggardliness of the company's CEO resulted in low employee morale and high turnover rates.
